Test Name: Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing (AST) for Mycobacterium tuberculosis Complex, First-Line Drugs
Specimen Type: Pure culture isolates of Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex from clinical specimens (e.g., sputum, BAL, pleural fluid, tissue)
Purpose: To determine the susceptibility of Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex isolates to first-line antitubercular drugs (isoniazid, rifampin, ethambutol, pyrazinamide) for guiding clinical therapy.
Container: Culture medium containers such as Middlebrook 7H10/7H11 agar plates or MGIT tubes holding the MTBC isolate
Equipment: Class II biosafety cabinet, 37 Â°C incubator, vortex mixer, autoclave/sterile filtration setup, sterile loops/pipettes
